alert.note: Alert for Bertie (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 12:43AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Bertie County through 145 AM EDT... At 1243 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Robersonville, or near Williamston, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Windsor around 110 AM EDT. Powellsville around 130 AM EDT. Colerain around 140 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Goose Pond, Whites Crossroads, Merry Hill, Connaritsa, Edenhouse, Republican, Trap, Mount Gould, Quitsna and Burden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM EDT for northeastern North Carolina.
